div.h2:
CAPITAL SCHOOL DISTRICT
COVID-19 INFORMATION
AND UPDATES

a.title: Senator Learning Kits

span.a:
Looking for Senator Learning Kits?
Click here

a.span: Capital School District Meal Delivery Information
Letter from Governor Carney on School Closure (3/23/2020)
Letter from Governor Carney on School Closure (3/13/20)

div.p:
Now broadcasting from Dr. Shelton via SchoolMessenger: (latest updates at http://bit.ly/csdstayhealthy)
We would like to take this opportunity to thank all of our families for their support and helping our students complete their Distance Learning Activities. Our teachers are currently working on the next round of Senators@Home Learning Activities and hopefully your students have been in touch with their teachers to provide support. If you have not received learning kits for your child at home please contact the school to update your contact information.
On Wednesday, the Capital Board of Education voted to modify the school calendar in light of the interruption that was caused by the pandemic. Please visit our website linked here. As part of the Calendar Change, Spring Break will now be Friday, April 10th and Monday April 13th only. Teachers and staff will not be working those days in distance learning. We know that many of our families have been able to take advantage of the breakfast and lunch program we have offered with over 50 stops throughout the community. With the Passover and Easter Holiday, our Food Delivery Program will be suspended on Friday April 10 and Monday April 14th and will resume on Tuesday April 15th.
On our website, there is information to support our students who may be experiencing distress during this unprecedented time in their lives. Should you feel that your child needs support please feel free to use the links on the website http://bit.ly/csdstayhealthy or contact the school. We are here to support you and your child.
Please don’t forget to complete your Census as it is the information that is used for funding schools. It is critical that the Census be accurate so we can fund our schools and community services.
Again, we would like to thank our staff for all that they have done to ensure that our students are safe, and remain connected with their schools. We would also like to thank our families for their flexibility in this trying time and your following the guidance from our Governor to stay home and if you must go out, to cover your face, not to protect yourself, but to protect others from any exposure you may bring to them, and to practice social distancing at all times. We are all in this together if we are going to #flattenthecurve and we appreciate all of our Senators for doing their part.
Dan Shelton
Superintendent
Capital School District

a.title: Latest News

h3.a: View an archive of all of our recent updates around COVID-19 here.

td.style: text-align: center; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(141, 179, 226);

a.title: Calendar

td.style: text-align: center; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(31, 73, 125);

p.span: All Schools in Capital School District are CLOSED from March 16 through May 15th.

td.style: text-align: center; vertical-align: middle; background-color: rgb(31, 73, 125);

p.span:
12 Month Employees are to report. All other employees please monitor email for communications.
Liberal Leave is in effect.

a.title: Facebook
Instagram
Twitter

h4.style: line-height: 1.44; margin-top: 12pt; margin-bottom: 8pt; font-size: 16px; text-align: center;

div.h4: Please review the recommendations from health officials below:

ul.li: Wash your hands often with soap and water, especially after coughing or sneezing. Alcohol-based hand cleaners that are at least 60-95% alcohol are also effective.

Cover your coughs and sneezes. The main way that the flu spreads from person to person is in the droplets produced by coughs and sneezes, so it is important to cover your mouth and nose with a tissue or cough/sneeze into your elbow or shoulder, not into your hands.
Do not share personal items such as drinks, food, or utensils.
Do not attend school if you are sick. Any student or staff who is determined to be sick while at school will be sent home.
Keep sick individuals at home for at least 24 hours after there is no longer a fever or signs of a fever without the use of fever-reducing medicine like ibuprofen or acetaminophen.

div.p: The Capital School District is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), national origin, citizenship or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or gender identity, against victims of domestic violence, sexual offenses, or stalking, or upon any other categories protected by federal, state, or local law. Inquiries regarding nondiscrimination policies should be directed to the Title IX, District 504 and ADA Coordinators: Capital School District, 198 Commerce Way, Dover DE 19904. Phone 302-672-1500
